column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Cha Cha Cha Ramen: This is supposed to be a garlic lover with tonkotsu based. Quite good
column2: but it needs one more push for Umami
column3: so by adding a small amount of Ramen flavor sauce and hot sauce with extra green onion
column4: you get a high quality ramen. The noodle is the thick one
column5: but unfortunately the broth is not thick enough to stick to the ramen noodle. But
column6: I still give this ramen a high remark for an overall great balance. It is worth a try and I will love to taste again.
